thread.title: College soccer roundup: Whit women tie unbeaten Loggers, 1-all
thread.title_full: College soccer roundup: Whit women tie unbeaten Loggers, 1-all

title: College soccer roundup: Whit women tie unbeaten Loggers, 1-all
text: Print this article Advertisement Whitman College played to a 1-all double overtime tie Sunday afternoon against Puget Sound on the Missionary athletic fields. The Missionaries trailed heading into halftime, but Lena de Guzman tied the game less than two minutes into the second half. The tie was Whitman’s second of Northwest Conference play and moved its overall record to 1-8-2 overall, and 1-4-2 in conference play. The Loggers remained unbeaten at 6-0-4 and 2-0-4, respectively. The Missionaries played primarily on the defensive side of the ball in the first half. Whitman goalie Haley Case kept busy, collecting two saves and facing four corners in the first 45 minutes. Puget Sound converted one corner into a goal in the 19th minute. Amalia Acorda-Fey connected with Emma Donckels, who sent a header into the back of the net, giving the Loggers a 1-0 advantage. Whitman wasted little time scoring in the second half; de Guzman sent a shot from outside the penalty box to the top-right of the net, tying the game at 1-1. Although, the Loggers were able to get a couple shots off in the latter part of the half, the Missionaries’ defense stayed strong, sending the game to overtime. The game took a turn toward the physical side in the first overtime period as Whitman and UPS combined for six fouls, with the Loggers receiving the first yellow card of the afternoon. Whitman next plays at Lewis & Clark on Sunday. MIssionary men tie Pacific on second-half goal FOREST GROVE, Ore. — Whitman’s Gabe Jacobsen scored a second-half goal, and the Northwest Conference men’s soccer match at Pacific University ended in a 1-1 tie after two overtime periods Sunday. Whitman (1-7-1 overall, 1-4-1 in the league) outshot Pacific (1-4-1), 24-6, but the Dragons hit the back of the net first at the 37th minute. The Missionaries rallied, and Jacobsen tied the score at the 60th. Meanwhile, Whitman shut out Pacific the rest of the afternoon. Baker Conte and Milo Cantor shared goalkeeping responsiblities, with Cantor. Pacific managed to take only one shot, not on goal, during Cantor’s 65 minutes between the pipes. The Missionaries next play Saturday in Spokane at Whitworth. More like this story
